alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Hardeman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:25AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Benton, southeastern Fayette and southwestern Hardeman Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 924 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lagrange, or 19 miles southwest of Bolivar, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lagrange, Grand Junction, La Grange, Hickory Valley, Saulsbury, Rogers Springs, Pattersonville, Van Buren, Forty Five and Ghost River State Natural Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
